item.description:
Highland Kitchen has hit upon the perfect formula for the area, a “gastropub” with solid bartending, good food, and a relaxed vibe.  The food here is comforting and often Cajun-tinged.  And the mixology is excellent, with bartending favorite Joe McGuirk among those shaking Somerville Sidecars.  You can hear it on the well-stocked jukebox, along with country, blues, and other eclectic nuggets: Highland Kitchen has soul.

The blackened catfish po’ boy was praised as one of the best sandwiches in Boston, while the black bean veggie burger with guacamole, pico de gallo, and jack cheese is hard to beat.  I like mine with bacon.  Yes, BACON!  Trust me. The HK menu has plenty of vegetarian options such as the Veggie Burger sans bacon, and the unbelievably good Buffalo Brussel Sprouts appetizer.

Check out Boston.com's review or Yelp's 350+ reviews which rates HK as 4 stars.

If you are interested in hanging out for a while, HK will be hosting a SPELLING BEE at 10PM.
item.how_to_find_us: I will be the bald dude possibly wearing a Meet-up name tag.
item.why: Highland Kitchen serves up great food for the Jumbo soul. Rated one of the Best Restaurants in the USA by Zagat among countless accolades, this neighborhood eatery offers up soulful food as well as a tremendous drink selection.
item.name: Jumbo Dinner: Highland Kitchen
